q1.question: Which programming languages are normally supported in programming contest environments?

q2.question: Rank the following complexity classes from lowest (fastest) to highest (slowest).

q3.question:
What is the time complexity of the following code? 
void f(vector<string> &a, vector<string> &b, vector<string> &c) {
    c.clear();

    for (auto e : a) {
        if (find(b.begin(), b.end(), e) != b.end()) {
            c.push_back(e);
        }
    }
}

q4.question:
What is the time complexity of the following code? 
void f(vector<string> &a, vector<string> &b, vector<string> &c) {
    c.clear();

    sort(b.begin(), b.end());

    for (auto e : a) {
        if (binary_search(b.begin(), b.end(), e)) {
            c.push_back(e);
        }
    }
}

q5.question: Which of the following statements about the course is true (select all that apply)?

responses.challenges: Students can drop one assigned challenge.
responses.style: Challenges are graded purely on correctness and not on style.
responses.external: Students must complete at least two external programming contests.
responses.final: There is a final exam in this course.
responses.participation: Students are expected to attend class regularly and on-time.
responses.deadlines: There are no deadlines in this class.
responses.officehours: There are both in-person and online office hours available to students.
responses.consulting: Students may consult online references or copy from resources if properly cited.
responses.copying: Students may consult or copy from solutions found online or from other students.
